message.content:
cs.LO, cs.PL, cs.SE, cs.FL, cs.LG. 

The paper discusses a logical framework for reasoning about structural operational semantics style specifications using the Abella system. This involves using lambda tree syntax to handle object language binding and encoding binding related properties in generic judgments. The paper also discusses embedding object language specifications directly into the reasoning framework through recursive definitions. These topics are all related to logic and programming languages, suggesting that the paper is likely to belong to the cs.LO (Logic in Computer Science) sub-category. Additionally, the paper discusses the use of generic properties of atomic predicates, which is related to programming language semantics and verification, suggesting that the paper may also belong to the cs.PL (Programming Languages) sub-category. The paper also discusses the utility of the Abella system for reasoning tasks, which is related to software engineering, suggesting that the paper may belong to the cs.SE (Software Engineering) sub-category. Finally, the paper discusses comparisons with other logic-based approaches, which is related to formal methods and logic, suggesting that the paper may also belong to the cs.FL (Formal Languages and Automata Theory) and cs.LG (Machine Learning) sub-categories.
